description: From Scots guddle, imitative of the splashing of water, and modelled after words like muddle and puddle, perhaps influenced by Scots gutter (“to spatter with mud”).

verbs.description: guddle (third-person singular simple present guddles, present participle guddling, simple past and past participle guddled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, Scotland, fishing) To catch (fish) with the hands, especially by groping at the bank of a stream or under stones.
